translation: Its form is not perceived here as such, nor its end, origin, foundation, or resting place; having cut asunder this firmly rooted peepul tree with the strong axe of non-attachment.
commentary: 15.3 Not not? form form? Its its? Ih here? And as such? available is perceived? Not not? Anta (its) end? Not not? f and? Adiá¸¥ (its) origin? Not not? f and? Sampratishtha foundation or resting place? Ashvattha Asvattha? Anam this? well-rooted firmrooted? with the ax of nonattachment? firmly strong? having cut asunder.Commentary The idea is continued in the next verse.So long as one
